intro: Solfia, commonly known as the common solfia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbel-like clusters. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in herbal medicine. Solfia is native to Europe and parts of Asia and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found growing in meadows, along stream banks, and in woodland edges.
